assumptions.margin_source_note: Department margins sourced from Navee Commerce, NYU Stern via Forbes, Dairy Industries/Milk Development Council (see Section 4 for quotes and URLs)

sources.margins: Navee Commerce, NYU Stern via Forbes, Dairy Industries (see Section 4 for quotes and URLs)
sources.untargeted_baseline: Wamsler et al. (2024), p. 158 - RFM-based targeting baseline

quotes: A frugal customer should receive a 6.4% discount after fourth purchase. A loyal customer should receive a 1.6% discount after second purchase. (p. 41)
We propose eight different segments for separate marketing strategies: Lost, Sleeping, Premium, Loyal, Promising, New, Frugal, and High_Check. (p. 38)
Live targeting triggers +44.2% purchase frequency vs. RFM-based targeting. (p. 160)
Redemption rate +10.5 percentage points versus RFM-based targeting. (p. 158)
Customer coverage between 30% and 60% represents the optimal balance between reach and efficiency for personalized promotion campaigns. (p. 158)
scientific_sources.used_for: Redemption rates, revenue lift, timing triggers, coverage benchmark

quotes: Bakery sales typically account for 2-4% of the total store sales with a 55% gross margin.
Deli sales typically account for 5% of the total store sales with a 40% gross margin.
The gross margin in grocery is typically 25% for dry grocery; 30% for grocery frozen
scientific_sources.used_for: Department gross margins: bakery (55%), deli (40%), frozen (30%), pantry (25%)

scientific_sources.source: NYU Stern School of Business via Forbes (2023)
quotes: Alcoholic beverages have a 44 percent gross margin, while soft drinks have a 53 percent gross margin
Retail grocery and food is at a 25 percent gross margin
scientific_sources.used_for: Beverage margins: alcohol (44%), soft drinks (53%); dry grocery baseline (25%)

quotes: Retailer margins on dairy products have increased significantly over the past ten years, with the gross margin on mature Cheddar rising to as much as 60%.
European grocery retailers face margin pressure with EBITDA margins declining from 6.9% in 2019 to 6.2% in 2024. (p. 42)
scientific_sources.used_for: EBITDA margin context (6.2%); NOTE: EBITDA is after operating expenses, gross margins above are before operating expenses

quotes: A 5% improvement in customer retention can lead to a 25% to 85% improvement in profitability. (p. 732)
scientific_sources.used_for: Retention-profitability link for Loyal segment strategy

margins.source_note: Department gross margins sourced from validated industry reports (NOT assumptions)

bakery.quote: Bakery sales typically account for 2-4% of the total store sales with a 55% gross margin.

deli.quote: Deli sales typically account for 5% of the total store sales with a 40% gross margin.

dairy eggs.quote: Retailer margins on dairy products have increased significantly over the past ten years, with the gross margin on mature Cheddar rising to as much as 60%.

pantry.source: NYU Stern School of Business via Forbes
pantry.quote: Retail grocery and food is at a 25 percent gross margin

beverages.source: NYU Stern School of Business via Forbes
beverages.quote: Soft drinks have a 53 percent gross margin

alcohol.source: NYU Stern School of Business via Forbes
alcohol.quote: Alcoholic beverages have a 44 percent gross margin

margins.nmc_methodology: Gross margin minus picking/distribution cost adjustments (Navee Commerce)

mckinsey_context.note: McKinsey (2025) reports EBITDA margins (after operating expenses); gross margins above are BEFORE operating expenses

margins.transparency_note: All department margins are sourced from publicly available industry reports with direct quotes; clearly documented for academic integrity

recommendations.margin_methodology: Department-specific gross margins from validated industry sources; weighted average for cross-department rules

validation.transparency_note: All department margins sourced from industry reports with direct quotes; clearly documented for academic integrity
